  • Trabajarás en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
  • Tendrás autonomía para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.
  • Ambiente colaborativo, con espacio para aprender y crecer en el mundo de producto digital.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

3 to 5 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Performance Data Analyst

Location: Brussels (50% on-site, 50% remote)

Duration: End of 2025

Start: ASAP

Languages: English + French OR Dutch




Role Overview:

Join the Measurement & Performance team within Marketing & Communication to analyze and visualize campaign performance, optimize strategies, and drive data-driven decision-making. You will work closely with the Campaign Manager, Product Owners, and Cluster Leads in this new department, requiring strong communication skills to translate data insights into actionable strategies.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop dashboards and reports to track marketing performance, campaign effectiveness, and customer behavior.
Analyze KPIs and campaign data to provide insights and recommend optimizations.
Ensure accurate data monitoring, integration, and visualization for data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with stakeholders to refine campaign strategies and business objectives.
Train users on reporting tools and foster a data-driven culture within the team.




Required Skills & Experience:

5+ years in data analysis, reporting, and visualization, with a focus on marketing, campaign performance, or business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and KPI tracking.
Experience in Marketing, Campaign, or Performance Analysis.
Excellent communication skills to work closely with the Campaign Manager, Product Owners, and Cluster Leads.
Experience in reporting and dashboard development.
Ideally experienced in SAS, Adobe Analytics, and Adobe Campaign.
Analytical mindset, ability to work under pressure, and strong business acumen.

Title: Alternance - Data Analyst Plurimédia Junior (F/H) - Septembre 2025 - 12 à 24 Mois
Description:
Le poste




Le groupe LVMH, leader mondial des produits de luxe, rassemble plus de 75 Maisons exceptionnelles créant des produits de haute qualité. Il est le seul acteur présent simultanément dans cinq grands secteurs du luxe : Vins & Spiritueux, Mode & Maroquinerie, Parfums & Cosmétiques, Montres & Joaillerie et Distribution sélective. Le groupe emploie actuellement plus de 213 000 personnes dans le monde entier et a généré un chiffre d'affaires de 86.2 milliards d'euros en 2023.




Les missions




Contexte du département :




Au sein du Département Media/Research/Image du groupe LVMH, en collaboration avec le responsable études Paid Media et en relation constante avec nos prestataires et les marques du groupe, vous contribuerez à :




Participer au suivi international de la visibilité concurrentielle de l’ensemble des maisons du Groupe (Mode, Beauté, Montre, Joaillerie, Vins et Spiritueux) sur les médias payants (Offline et Online).




Analyses de données Plurimedia

Analyse de la visibilité des marques à partir de leurs investissements publicitaires sur les différents médias payants Offline et Online (Presse, TV, Affichage, Cinéma, Radio, Paid Social, Paid Search, Display)

Gestion et coordination des flux de données en lien avec les agences et fournisseurs locaux
Consolidation mensuelle dans une base de données centralisée
Vérification de la qualité de la donnée et de l’application des différentes règles de gestion
Contrôle de la visualisation des rapports mensuels et annuels (PowerBI)
Participation à l’élaboration des analyses trimestrielles




Ad Hoc Analysis
Production d’analyses d’investissements publicitaires à destination des Maisons du groupe ou du top management suivant les différents besoins.
Accompagner les maisons dans leurs besoins en études médias (notamment sur le Digital).




Votre profil




Vous êtes étudiant(e) en dernière année d'école de commerce, d'université ou équivalent et vous recherchez une alternance idéalement pour 2 ans.
Vous avez un vif intérêt et une curiosité pour les médias, la communication et le secteur du luxe.
Vous êtes rigoureux(se) et vous avez une capacité d'analyse et de synthèse.
Vous disposez d’une aisance relationnelle et rédactionnelle reconnue.
Vous maitrisez le Pack Office (PowerPoint…). Une maîtrise avancée d'Excel et PowerBI est essentielle, la connaissance de SQL et Python est un plus.
Vous disposez d’un anglais courant à l’écrit et à l’oral.
A l’image de nos Maisons, vous serez attentif(ve) aux détails et saurez incarner les valeurs du Groupe LVMH : Créativité, Innovation, Excellence et Esprit d’entreprise.




Informations complémentaires




Avantages :

Tickets restaurant, 75% du titre de transport remboursé, accès à la salle de sport à un tarif préférentiel, vélos électriques mis à disposition gratuitement.




L'offre d’alternance est basée dans le 8ème arrondissement de Paris, et est à pourvoir à partir de Septembre 2025.




LVMH reconnaît et recrute tous les talents.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Prosegur es la empresa líder en seguridad en España. Con más de 32.000 empleados a nivel nacional y más de 190.000 a nivel internacional, tiene presencia en más de 22 países y más de 700 sedes repartidas por todo el mundo.

Todo ello hace de Prosegur una gran empresa que ofrece grandes posibilidades de desarrollo profesional. Prosegur es un excelente lugar para trabajar por muchas razones: Una gran compañía, Grandes retos y oportunidades, Innovación, Los mejores profesionales y las mejores personas y Aportación a la sociedad. Además en Prosegur vivimos nuestros valores con pasión, son algo que nos define y por eso, nos gusta ponerlos de manifiesto en nuestro trabajo todos los días y compartirlos.




¡QUEREMOS CRECER CONTIGO!




¿Cuál será tu día a día?

-Análisis de datos, creación de dashboards y reportes que ayuden en la toma de decisiones del área Comercial.

-Implementación de modelos de machine learning para predicción de resultados.

Optimización de base de datos y mejora en tiempos de consulta.

-Pensamiento analítico y resolución de problemas.

-Toma de requerimientos Preparación y análisis de los resultados de las ventas en relación con los objetivos marcados por la dirección y propuesta de acciones.

-Estudio de las variables que impactan en la comercialización de productos del negocio de Cash.

Participación en el diseño y elaboración de informes sobre la actividad comercial:

Oportunidades de negocio y ofertas realizadas.
Extracción y análisis de datos.
Propuesta de modificaciones y mejoras en los informes recurrentes.

-Actualización y mantenimiento de la aplicación de CRM, atendiendo a las necesidades de los usuarios:

-Colaborar en proyectos de agilización de procesos y procedimientos automatización.

-Colaborar activamente con el equipo Comercial.




¿Qué buscamos de ti?

Estudios superiores.
Idealmente con certificaciones en análisis de datos, SQL, PBI, Python
Imprescindible experiencia en Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics
Análisis de Manejo de herramientas de análisis de datos y bases de datos.
Dominio del Excel y herramientas de automatización.
Experiencia en gestión de proyectos




Valores

Orientación a resultados
Iniciativa
Trabajo en equipo
Habilidades comunicativas
Autonomía
Innovación
Capacidad de toma de decisiones




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido desde un primer momento.
Salario Fijo y variable.
Jornada completa.
Herramientas para desarrollar el trabajo: Tablet, móvil de empresa, herramientas de marketing.
Plan de carrera profesional.

Title: Data Analyst – Power BI & SQL
Description:
¿Te apasiona el mundo del Big Data y Business Intelligence? 👀




➥ Unirte a Innova-tsn es formar parte de una empresa de consultoría líder a nivel nacional y en pleno desarrollo internacional. Si estás interesado en participar en proyectos innovadores de IA, Cloud Computing y Transformación Digital, creemos que este es tu lugar.




Buscamos un Data Analyst con buen dominio de SQL y PowerBI, para trabajar mano a mano con usuarios del área de logística y participar en la extracción y visualización de información clave para la toma de decisiones. Un rol donde tus análisis realmente se van a utilizar.




📌 ¿Qué buscamos?

Queremos a alguien que ya haya dado sus primeros pasos como analista (2 a 5 años de experiencia) y esté listo para dar un paso más en su carrera, combinando análisis con contacto funcional.




Estas serán tus principales funciones:

Desarrollo de reporting y dashboards con PowerBI a nivel avanzado.
Extracción y análisis de datos desde Big Query (no pedimos que seas experto, pero sí con ganas de aprender).
Interacción directa con usuarios del negocio, para entender qué necesitan y transformar eso en soluciones concretas.
Colaboración presencial 3 días por semana en nuestras oficinas de Madrid (vas a tener contacto real con el equipo y los usuarios).




Además, si conoces Microstrategy, has trabajado en entornos logísticos o tienes ese perfil híbrido que entiende tanto de datos como del negocio, encajaras especialmente bien.




📈 ¿Qué valoramos además?

Formación universitaria en matemáticas, estadística, economía, ingeniería o similares.
Mentalidad analítica y orientación al cliente interno.
Ganas de trabajar en equipo y seguir aprendiendo.
Competencia en inglés para algunos proyectos internacionales (no imprescindible).




👋 ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?

Contrato indefinido y oportunidades de crecimiento.
Planes de carrera personalizados y formación continua con certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
Oportunidades de crecimiento: podés especializarte en tecnología o evolucionar hacia roles de liderazgo técnico o gestión, según tus intereses.
Proyectos diversos en múltiples sectores con tecnologías en constante evolución.
Ambiente colaborativo y equipo con experiencia, donde podés aprender y compartir conocimientos.
Beneficios sociales: seguro médico completo y retribución flexible (ticket restaurante, guardería y transporte)




En Innova apostamos por el talento, el aprendizaje constante y los entornos donde cada persona puede crecer. Si buscas un lugar donde desarrollarte, aplicar lo que sabes y seguir evolucionando en el mundo del dato, APLICA!! nos encantaría conocerte. 🤓

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

Job Description

We are looking for an Associate Data Analyst, who will report to Head of Analytics - Identity and Fraud.

What You Are Going To Do


Extract, formulate and manipulate data to create the structured samples necessary to address requirements
Interpret analysis results
Identify and contribute to the resolution of data or analytical problems which may affect on results, looking for advice
Provide status reports to project lead/consultant
Communicate with clients and other departments/divisions within Experian to help ensure accurate implementation of project work
Attend and contribute to client/customer meetings, including presenting own results, conclusions and recommendations in both written and verbal form.


Qualifications

What you are expected to bring:


Degree or equivalent standard, with a high numeric content e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Economics, Physical Sciences.
Experience of statistical / analytical project work.
Understanding of how scoring models are used within implemented solutions.
PC literate with experience in the use of coding languages (namely Python, SAS), statistical packages and Office tools.
Knowledge of Experian ID&F products and scores. Understanding of how these are used within a client environment.
Basic knowledge of ID&F data and value added products and how these are used within a client environment.


What You Will Get


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.


Additional Information

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Our Social Benefits Package - the way we care for our People

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

Job Description

We are looking for an Associate Data Analyst, who will report to Head of Analytics - Identity and Fraud.

What You Are Going To Do

  • Extract, formulate and manipulate data to create the structured samples necessary to address requirements
  • Interpret analysis results
  • Identify and contribute to the resolution of data or analytical problems which may affect on results, looking for advice
  • Provide status reports to project lead/consultant
  • Communicate with clients and other departments/divisions within Experian to help ensure accurate implementation of project work
  • Attend and contribute to client/customer meetings, including presenting own results, conclusions and recommendations in both written and verbal form.

Qualifications

What you are expected to bring:

  • Degree or equivalent standard, with a high numeric content e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Economics, Physical Sciences.
  • Experience of statistical / analytical project work.
  • Understanding of how scoring models are used within implemented solutions.
  • PC literate with experience in the use of coding languages (namely Python, SAS), statistical packages and Office tools.
  • Knowledge of Experian ID&F products and scores. Understanding of how these are used within a client environment.
  • Basic knowledge of ID&F data and value added products and how these are used within a client environment.

What You Will Get

  • Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
  • Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
  • Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
  • Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
  • Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.

Additional Information

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Our Social Benefits Package - the way we care for our People

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Finance team is a strategic partner driving business growth and setting new standards with innovative, market-leading financial solutions. Our mission is to provide accurate, timely financial information and insights, optimize performance through strategic planning and resource allocation, and foster accountability and integrity. We handle accounting, controlling, budgeting and planning, data and financial analysis, finance automation, procurement, and treasury functions.

Main Responsibilities


Collaborate on group-wide projects focused on the standardization and optimization of financial and operational data and metrics
Analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify root causes, uncover interdependencies, forecast trends, and provide actionable insights and recommendations
Develop and maintain standardized and ad hoc reports on critical KPIs and areas requiring attention
Design, support and replicate scalable data structures, including table creation, reporting, and data visualizations, to meet business unit needs





Core Requirements


A minimum of 2 years of experience in a Data Analytics role
Experience extracting, manipulating, and analysing complex data using SQL while using Python is an advantage;
Demonstrated expertise in communicating insights, streamlining reporting processes, and utilizing BI tools for data visualization (experience with PowerBI or Looker is a plus)
Strong proficiency in both written and spoken English
Prior experience in e-commerce, SaaS, or digital marketing environments is preferred
Background or experience in finance is an added advantage





Salary Range


Gross Salary 1990 - 3850 EUR/Month.





About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.
And we’re always looking to expand our team of:



Future shapers
Restless achievers
Self-movers
Honest communicators
Team players





What We Offer


Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand;
Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
Health benefits. Private health insurance, online and on-site workouts, consultations to feel and be your best;
Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
More free time. Stay with us and additional vacation days will be added to your calendar;
Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement





Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area.
Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime.
Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI
Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions
Good knowledge about SQL.
Good level of English - minimum B2
Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / Data Analyst”.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (HR Information Systems Analyst)




I am working with a client who are looking for a HR Information Systems Analyst to take ownership of all HR systems, ensuring data integrity, day-to-day operational management, and system upgrades. In this role, you will support the broader HR team with reporting and data analysis. The ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role within professional services or a complex corporate environment.




About the Role

In this role, you will:




Manage data integrity across HR systems (People XD & Cornerstone) and related processes.
Lead HR system renewals, upgrades, integration projects, and new system implementations as needed.
Build strong vendor relationships with Access and Cornerstone to maximise system value, ensuring issues and queries are resolved promptly.
Oversee system management for the annual performance review cycle and promotion processes, including bulk uploads and documentation.
Provide training, support, and expert guidance to HR and system users.
Monitor data quality through consistent data capture, reconciliations, and regular audits.
Collaborate with Finance, IT, and other departments to support internal projects, including salary reviews, gender pay gap reporting, and D&I initiatives.




About You

You are an experienced HR Systems / Data Analyst with a proactive, solutions-driven approach.
You work effectively across teams, with strong communication and relationship-building skills.
You have an analytical mindset, excellent attention to detail, and strong organisational and critical thinking abilities.
You possess advanced Excel skills and can derive meaningful insights from data.
You understand the importance of confidentiality in this role.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern (H/F/N)
Description:
Company Description

Believe is one of the world’s leading digital music companies. Believe’s mission is to develop local artists and labels in the digital ecosystem by providing them the solutions they need to grow their audience at each stage of their career and development.

Its 2,020 employees in more than 50 countries aim to support local artists and labels with a unique digital expertise, respect, fairness and transparency.

To support our fast-growing presence on all continents, we are constantly looking for new Believers to join us and make a stronger and more positive impact on the music industry!

Believe is listed on compartment A of the regulated market of Euronext Paris (Ticker: BLV, ISIN: FR0014003FE9).

Ready to #setthetone with Believe?

Job Description

ROLE’S EXPECTATIONS

As a Data Analyst Intern in the Product Team, you will contribute to the success and growth of many artists and labels. Your insights will directly shape the strategies that help artists grow their fanbase and reach new heights in their careers. You'll dive into cutting-edge projects, from developing advanced data models to uncovering viral trends that shape the music industry by analyzing impact of Believe’s partners, including Spotify, YouTube, TikTok, and others...

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include

Creation and improvement of Power BI Dashboards:


design and develop dashboards to track the performance and accuracy of Tiktok viral trends detection data models,
follow the adoption of Believe products by artist, producers and internal teams,


Conducting Ad Hoc Analyses to support artists making the best decisions to develop their audience at every stage of their career, Turn your insights into actionable data models that will be integrated into our products, helping artists make informed decisions every day.

Qualifications


Demonstrated interest for the music industry,
studying in last year of a master’s degree from an Engineering or Business school with a specialization in data. Looking for an end-of-studies internship,
previous internship or student experience working with data or analytic topics,
proficient with SQL and visualization tools, Python a plus. Anyway, you are curious and fast learner, you love watching online tutorial until you become expert in a new coding language,
fluent in English, spoken and written. Comfortable working day to day in English.


Additional Information

Our interview process is designed to be as transparent and supportive as possible, giving you a chance to showcase your skills and learn more about our team. The process will consist of one HR fit interview, one case study to test analytic skills and two interviews with the team.

Ready to make your mark on the future of music? Apply now and start your journey with Believe!

Set the tone with us

Working at Believe means having individual and collective impact in a fast-growing company!

At all stages of their careers, Believers are an important part of what we are doing: shaping the future of the music industry.

We need teams that truly reflect the diversity of our clients: our international presence is an inspiring and enriching work environment for each one of us, with daily opportunities to connect with our colleagues all over the world.

We have two hearts at Believe - our People and our Artists.

We believe in THE POWER OF OUR PEOPLE, who grow every day to develop their potential… We aim to provide our Believers with the best environment to thrive.

Title: Data Analyst, Aftermarket
Description:
Data Analyst Aftermarket

Bydgoszcz, Poland

SPX Flow – Globally And Locally

SPX FLOW, Inc. manufactures and supplies engineered flow components, process equipment, and turn-key systems. The Company offers 20 brands of pumps, valves, mixes, air dryers, hydraulic tools, homogenizers, separators, and heat exchangers, filtration solutions as well as aftermarket parts and services.

SPX FLOW serves food and beverage, health, and industrial manufacturers, bringing together trusted brands and technologies to meet new consumer expectations and anticipate industry trends. Many of your household goods & favorite snacks may have been created with the help of SPX Flow solutions.

SPX Flow has been established for over 100 years! Headquartered in North Carolina, we have operations in more than 25 countries and a broad global customer base. Our 5000 employees worldwide innovate to design, deliver and service high-value solutions for our customers.

As a world leader in sustainable solutions, we’ve launched projects at our facilities to save energy and reduce waste, and we engineer efficiency into our products and technologies to help our customers do the same. We currently hold more than 550 patents worldwide, and roughly 44% of them are related to sustainability and clean technology.

SPX flow at Bydgoszcz, Poland is looking for Data Analyst

About The Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a passion for data analysis, problem-solving, and a desire to make an impact within our organization. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with our managers to support the collection, processing, and analysis of data to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions.

About Your Responsibilities At SPX Flow


Gathering, cleaning, and organizing large sets of data from various internal sources
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key business metrics
Define, implement, and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess Aftermarket and Supply Chain performance
Conduct basic statistical analysis to support data-driven decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and business needs
Generate ad-hoc reports and insights based on business requests
Help improve data collection processes and ensure data integrity
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to data analysis
Be involved in internal data projects with company wide impact


About You


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field
3+ years of experience in a related role within an industrial or manufacturing environment
Proficiency in Excel experience with SQL is a plus
Proficiency with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Proficiency with SAP 5&6 / HANA
MS Office knowledge mandatory
Knowledge of basic statistical methods and techniques, Lean Six Sigma qualification is a plus
Very good English skills in spoken and written (business fluent)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new tools and technologies
Know how within Incident-, Problem- and Change Management
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team


About Your Benefits


Performance & recognition programs.
Bonus structures (depending on company and personal performance).
Family friendly policies.
Genuine progression and development opportunities with a global organization.
Healthy minds and healthy lives resources.
Retirement savings plans with company contributions.


About The Company Globally

At SPX FLOW, sustainability is more than a buzzword. It’s a way forward. We improve the world through innovative, sustainable solutions. 

Check out our sustainable solutions here: here

We put people first, creating opportunities for everyone, and we give back to our communities too. Our team members are what make SPX FLOW special.

Next steps?

Does it sound as your next job? Be our solution in the making and apply now!

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst - remote, full-time
Description:
Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-time

At Whizz, we are dedicated to developing high-quality digital solutions that enhance the mobility experience. As we grow, we are looking for a Data Analyst with a strong background in SQL, dashboard creation, and experience working with Metabase. If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and contributing to a fast-paced, mission-driven team — this role is for you!

About the Role:

As a Data Analyst at Whizz, you will be responsible for transforming raw data into meaningful insights that drive key business decisions. You'll work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Operations, and Engineering, to support strategic initiatives and improve performance across the organization.

Responsibilities:


Create and maintain analytical dashboards using SQL queries for custom charts and tables (Metabase)
Сreate reports to visualize data insights for management (Metabase)
Perform various ad hoc research and analysis to support operational and strategic decisions
Analyze customer behavior, operational performance, and product usage trends
Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to define KPIs and monitor performance
Translate business needs into technical specifications and data models
Ensure data integrity and consistency across reports and dashboards
All other duties as assigned



Requirements

Requirements:


Proven experience in SQL, data analysis, and dashboard creation
Strong working knowledge of Metabase is required
Good understanding of data visualization best practices and performance optimization
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English and Russian


Nice to Have:


Understanding of statistical methods and predictive analytics
Familiarity with API data sources and automation tools
Knowledge of data security and privacy best practices



Benefits

What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits
A dynamic and collaborative work environment
Remote work flexibility with opportunities for professional growth
The chance to be part of a company that is transforming the mobility industry
Show more

Title: Middle Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We are a 2022 and 2020 Salesforce Innovation Award Winner, and 1 of only 9 Salesforce Product Development Outsourcers (PDOs) worldwide. This ranks us as one of the top Salesforce consulting companies in the market today.

We are a team of highly trained experts that are passionate about the Salesforce ecosystem and helping our clients achieve their digital transformation goals within that ecosystem. We help them achieve these goals by providing a wide range of services such as development, implementation, integration, customization, maintenance, and support.

With26years in the market, 16 offices across 12 countries and over 2,000 successful projects deployed we have learned how to create a dynamic and fun working environment all while constantly investing in our teams by providing them professional development and career growth opportunities

Job Description

Job Specification

As a Middle Data Analyst, you will play a key role in data analysis, visualization, and reporting, working with diverse data sources to provide valuable insights for decision-making. You will be responsible for data modeling, dashboard development, and advanced analytics while collaborating with stakeholders to understand business challenges. In this role, you will work on complex data sets, optimize data processing pipelines, and help improve data accuracy.

Job Responsibilities


Engage with clients and stakeholders to understand data requirements and business challenges
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from multiple sources into centralized storage solutions
Conduct advanced exploratory data analysis and statistical modeling to uncover insights
Build and optimize dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using Salesforce CRM Analytics, Tableau, Power BI
Work on data cleaning, enrichment, and validation to ensure high-quality analytics outputs
Collaborate with developers to optimize data pipelines and automation processes
Present insights and findings to senior stakeholders and leadership teams
Stay up to date with best practices in data analytics, visualization, and AI-driven analysis


Qualifications


2,5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role
Strong SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases
Experience with Python or R for data manipulation and statistical analysis
Proficiency in data visualization tools: Tableau is a must; experience with other tools such as Power BI and Salesforce CRM Analytics is a plus
Knowledge of ETL processes and data modeling best practices
Strong logical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Ability to interpret data trends, patterns, and insights effectively
Experience with Salesforce ecosystemis a plus


Additional Information


Competitive salary (B2B or regular employment)
Private medical healthcare and Life Insurance (with family options)
Benefit system (multisport card, tickets to cinema or theatre, etc.)
Warsaw office located in a trendy district
Employment in an international organization in the most interesting and challenging industry
Chance to have a direct impact on company growth
Constant team support and mentoring
Flexible working hours
Paid time off and bank holidays for contractors
Regular company parties
Monthly company breakfasts
Show more

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.




We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.




With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data & Reporting Analyst (PowerBI) to integrate one of the biggest banks in Europe, with activity in over 70 countries around the world, it also counts with over 150 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry.




You will join an international and diverse team based in Oporto (hybrid).




What you are like:

At least 4 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Respect the procedures, methodologies, and directives.




Why join us:

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
… and much more!

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
En Wetaca queremos convertirnos en un movimiento de gente que quiere vivir bien en todos los sentidos.




El ritmo de vida actual lleva a muchas personas a tener que elegir entre comer comer rico y comer sano o a priorizar la rapidez, dejando en un segundo plano la calidad y sabor de lo que comen en su día a día. Por eso en Wetaca cocinamos para que comer genial esté al alcance de todos y la comida sea un sinónimo de disfrute, bienestar y tranquilidad.




Somos la suscripción semanal de comida a domicilio líder del mercado y repartimos en toda la península. Cocinamos comida casera y real (con ingredientes naturales, sin aditivos ni conservantes y todo desde cero) para ofrecer menús variados y para todos los gustos, para que nuestros clientes coman bien y ganen tiempo para sí mismos. Nuestro objetivo es que confíen en nosotros y nos deleguen el preparar su comida, que sepan que We TAke CAre, que nosotros nos encargamos de todo.




Si eres una persona con hambre y buscas un sitio en el que crecer, tenemos una vacante para ti.




Buscamos un Product Data Analyst con 2-3 años de experiencia, capaz de entender las necesidades del producto digital y transformarlas en datos e insights accionables para mejorar la experiencia de nuestros usuarios. Formará parte del equipo de producto digital, desempeñando un rol clave en el análisis del comportamiento de los usuarios y la evaluación del impacto de nuevas funcionalidades, ayudándonos a descubrir oportunidades de negocio.




¿Qué harás?

Potencia la toma de decisiones en un equipo de producto digital.

Autonomía para plantear hipótesis e identificar qué información es clave para responder preguntas de negocio y producto.
Extraer y analizar datos directamente desde fuentes como SQL y Google Analytics con un enfoque técnico y proactivo.
Conocimientos en Python/R para procesamiento y análisis avanzado de datos.
Capacidad para procesar y estructurar consultas.
Detectar tendencias en datos históricos y proyectar futuros comportamientos para guiar la toma de decisiones.
Medir y validar hipótesis de experimentos y pruebas A/B.
Preparar informes para responder a preguntas clave utilizando herramientas como Looker, Power BI o similares.




En definitiva, colaborar de cerca con Producto, Diseño y IT para identificar oportunidades de crecimiento y mejorar la experiencia del usuario con datos.




¿Quién eres?

2-3 años de experiencia en un rol analítico, aportando insights accionables.
Formación o experiencia en disciplinas cuantitativas (Economía, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, etc.).
Sólidos conocimientos de lenguajes de programación y herramientas de análisis y procesamiento de datos: SQL, Python, R.
Base en estadística y experimentación (A/B testing, cohort analysis, modelos de segmentación).
Habilidad para visualizar datos y comunicar insights de forma clara y accionable.
Mentalidad analítica y colaborativa, con ganas de trabajar codo a codo con Producto, Diseño y Tech.




¿Cómo estarás?

Trabajarás en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
Tendrás autonomía para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.
Ambiente colaborativo, con espacio para aprender y crecer en el mundo de producto digital.

Show more

  • Trabajarás en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
  • Tendrás autonomía para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.
  • Ambiente colaborativo, con espacio para aprender y crecer en el mundo de producto digital.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's and/or master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar;
At least 5 years as a data analyst
Experience with PowerBI/Tableau
Fluent in English and Portuguese;
Good communication and interpersonal skills;
Be already in Portugal legally, available to do a hybrid model in Lisbon.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been electedWe believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.




At KCS IT, we stand for equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

All applications with the required skills for the position are welcome!

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST
HTML:
Nell'ambito di un ampliamento del nostro team Amministrazione Finanza e Controllo cerchiamo un:

JUNIOR DATA ANALYST

  • Zona: Milano Sede;
  • Disponibilità di inserimento: da subito.

Attività

La risorsa lavorerà a stretto contatto con il Resp. AFC e con il Sales Controller nell’analisi dei dati di sell-in e sell- out sapendo commentare in modo critico e strutturato il loro andamento ed in particolare confrontando budget actual e forecast nonché le performance operative della forza vendita per fornire utili visioni previsionali.

Dovrà contribuire positivamente alla strutturazione di un sistema di reporting aziendale settimanale e mensile ed offrire supporto al Team Marketing e Commerciale nel corretto utilizzo e valorizzazione del CRM aziendale.

Requisiti

  • Pregressa esperienza nel ruolo di circa 2 anni, saranno ritenute valide anche candidature provenienti da un’esperienza di stage;
  • Capacità di elaborare informazioni aziendali complesse e di presentarle con sensibilità agli stakeholder aziendali;
  • Pensiero analitico e problem-solving, precisione e attenzione ai dettagli, curiosità e voglia di imparare, adattabilità e flessibilità, propensione al lavoro di team;
  • Esperienza pregressa, anche breve, nell'utilizzo di qualsiasi sistema CRM (TrueBlue, Veeva, OCE, Salesforce, ecc.) e nella creazione di dashboard in Power BI.

Si Offre

  • Assunzione a tempo indeterminato;
  • Un percorso di carriera strutturato, volto alla valorizzazione e al potenziamento delle competenze.

Title: Data Analysis Intern
Description:
Overview:

Draper is an independent, nonprofit research and development company headquartered in Cambridge, MA. The 2,000+ employees of Draper tackle important national challenges with a promise of delivering successful and usable solutions. From military defense and space exploration to biomedical engineering, lives often depend on the solutions we provide. Our multidisciplinary teams of engineers and scientists work in a collaborative environment that inspires the cross-fertilization of ideas necessary for true innovation. For more information about Draper, visit www.draper.com.

Job Description Summary:

Engineering Student internships support the research and development of new or existing computer systems (hardware, software, components, and materials) or may assist in sustaining and improving the quality processes across the full engineering and manufacturing life cycle. Student interns will contribute to projects in various engineering disciplines such as computer hardware or software design and development, electro-optical design, optical and thermal model development, bioengineering, materials testing, electrical system design, hardware assembly, testing, etc. Student interns will test and evaluate products, systems, or components and work with various applications such as LabVIEW, MATLAB, SolidWorks, COMSOL, ANSYS, Mentor Graphics, Python, and GitLab. Student interns collaborate with engineers or technicians to build and test systems, hardware, or components on various projects. They may also be involved in ensuring quality products are produced and quality procedures are upheld.

Duties/Responsibilities

Job Description:


Design, develop, and enhancement engineering solutions for challenging problems.
Implement, test, perform analysis, and provide documentation support.
Generate and present test reports including plots, tables, evaluation criteria, and conclusions from data collected and analyzed throughout the test process.
Complete assignments designed to develop a practical knowledge of processes, procedures, equipment, facilities, and systems as well as their interrelationships within engineering disciplines.
Performs other duties as assigned.


Program Requirements


Enrolled in an accredited full-time undergraduate or graduate degree program required.
There is flexibility regarding hours and program duration based on applicant’s school schedule and availability.

From military defense and space exploration to biomedical engineering, lives often depend on the solutions we provide. Our multidisciplinary teams of engineers and scientists work in a collaborative environment that inspires the cross-fertilization of ideas necessary for true innovation. For more information about Draper, visit www.draper.com.

Job Description Summary:

Engineering Student internships support the research and development of new or existing computer systems (hardware, software, components, and materials) or may assist in sustaining and improving the quality processes across the full engineering and manufacturing life cycle. Student interns will contribute to projects in various engineering disciplines such as computer hardware or software design and development, electro-optical design, optical and thermal model development, bioengineering, materials testing, electrical system design, hardware assembly, testing, etc. Student interns will test and evaluate products, systems, or components and work with various applications such as LabVIEW, MATLAB, SolidWorks, COMSOL, ANSYS, Mentor Graphics, Python, and GitLab. Student interns collaborate with engineers or technicians to build and test systems, hardware, or components on various projects. They may also be involved in ensuring quality products are produced and quality procedures are upheld.

  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a specialist real estate consulting firm, is taking an innovative and disruptive approach to structuring property development deals. They are seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst to support data administrative tasks for a large, complex project with a US-based client.




Responsibilities:

Identify and autonomously reach out to global stakeholders to gather essential sustainability data.
Perform thematic analysis of findings, drawing actionable insights before aggregating data.
Assist in the creation and management of an initiative tracking tool for business use.
Handle data-heavy administrative tasks to ensure smooth project operations.




Requirements:

1-2 years of experience in data analysis.
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field
Proven experience with data-heavy administrative tasks.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Proactive, go-getter, with interest in sustainability




Details:

Start date: ASAP
Location: US-based (remote possible, close to EDT or PDT time zones)
Salary: $60,000 - $80,000 pro-rated Fixed Term Contract
Duration: 6 months

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Supply Chain Data Analyst II

We are seeking an experienced Supply Chain Data Analyst to develop and optimize data-driven insights that enhance operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, technical proficiency, and experience in business intelligence tools to support data modeling and visualization for supply chain metrics.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and optimize supply chain dashboards to track key metrics such as on-time delivery, delivery health, and in-stock performance.
Create end-to-end dashboards utilizing Tableau and AWS Quicksight.
Utilize advanced SQL skills to manipulate, analyze, and extract insights from large datasets.
Work closely with supply chain and manufacturing stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into actionable data insights.
Apply project and program management expertise to streamline data analysis and reporting processes.
Support cost, lead time, and demand data modeling to enhance supply chain efficiency.
Leverage business intelligence tools to drive strategic decision-making and operational improvements.


Top 3 Must-Have Skills


Data Visualization & Dashboarding – Expertise in Tableau, AWS Quicksight, and other visualization tools.
SQL Proficiency – Advanced SQL skills to query and manipulate large datasets effectively.
Business Intelligence & Analytics – Experience in supply chain metrics, cost modeling, and demand forecasting.


Skills & Experience Required


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Computer Science.
Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or supply chain analytics.
Strong knowledge of supply chain and manufacturing processes.
Proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, and macros.
Strong stakeholder communication skills for presenting insights and driving data-informed decisions.
Experience with project and program management to improve reporting processes and operational efficiency.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working with large-scale datasets in a supply chain or manufacturing environment.
Ability to model supply chain costs, lead times, and demand trends.
Familiarity with additional programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.


This role offers an exciting opportunity to leverage data-driven insights to improve supply chain efficiency, working closely with key business stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a passion for analytics, strong technical skills, and the ability to drive strategic decision-making through data visualization and business intelligence tools.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At H2Ok Innovations, we're leading the charge in cleantech innovation, reshaping process industrials and manufacturing to drive operational efficiency and sustainability for our world’s most foundational industries. Powered by our H2Ok AI Co-pilot models and state-of-the-art sensors, our solutions optimize facility performance across various processes, including process manufacturing, production, water management, energy reduction, and waste minimization. Based at Greentown Labs, North America's premier cleantech innovation community, we're a woman-founded startup backed by renowned investors like Construct Capital, 2048 Ventures, and Flybridge Capital. Our groundbreaking technologies have earned accolades and adoption from industry giants like Unilever, The Coca-Cola Company, ABinBev, and Mitsubishi Electric. We're committed to unlocking untapped data for our customers, empowering them to gain a competitive edge and create Industry 4.0.

Transforming our most foundational sectors of society is hard. Very hard. But we’re building an empire. And empire building is not easy. It’s deeply fulfilling, and you will learn and grow tremendously while driving sustainable impact globally with some of the largest players that make everything we eat, use, and wear. Our culture is to foster extraordinary growth within our teammates. We believe in autonomy, ownership, empowerment, demanding excellence, being mission-driven. We believe in creativity, authenticity, and extraordinary growth. We’re looking for relentless, ambitious, creative, and exceptional people to join our team and build the factory of the future.

As our company scales, we're in search of a full-time Data Analyst to join our expanding team. As a Data Analyst, you will work directly with customers on high-impact immediate problems – interpreting, explaining, and ultimately bringing life to their data. Based on your analysis, you will use H2Ok’s ML platform to build machine learning models that drive value for our customers, saving them time, water, and energy. Your responsibilities will look similar to those of a hands-on AI startup CTO where you will work cross-functionally in sales, customer success, and product delivery to own the delivery of high-impact projects to global clients. The ideal candidate is an excellent critical thinker, a clear and engaging communicator, and knows how to not only explain data, but how to tell a compelling story. Having a background in chemical engineering, process engineering, mechanical engineering, or computer science is a plus.

What You Will Do


Analyze data from some of the largest factories in the world to identify process inefficiencies, anomalies, and areas of potential optimization
Interpret, explain, and shed light on complex data through engaging presentations and live demonstrations to customers and internal stakeholders.
Use H2Ok’s ML platform to train, evaluate, and deploy machine learning models to unlock additional factory uptime and deliver time, energy, and water savings.
Apply critical thinking and first principles knowledge to solve challenging, real-world problems in factories, breweries, food & beverage facilities, and more.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and customer stakeholders to ensure models are performant, reliable, and aligned with customer needs





About You


Fluent in analyzing, understanding, and communicating about data, especially time-series data or sensor data.
Willing to work directly with customers to explain model results, data analysis, and conclusions from data in a clear, engaging, and succinct way.
Skilled in data storytelling and visualization.
Can create engaging, colorful visualizations for customers that bring data to life and provide insight.
Experienced with presenting data and communicating results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Experienced with Python, including numerical libraries (such as NumPy and Pandas) and familiar with at least one ML framework (such as Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX).
Familiar training, fine-tuning, and evaluating performance of machine learning models. Familiar with SQL or similar database systems (such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Experienced with Git or other version control systems
Analytical thinker with the ability to solve complex problems efficiently
Excellent communication skills to articulate technical issues, solutions, and progress effectively
Adaptability to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving project requirements
Strong team player mindset, comfortable sharing knowledge and collaborating within a team environment
Familiarity with industrial processes and manufacturing industries such as chemicals, pharmaceuticals, food and beverage, CPG, brewing, dairy, and industrial controls (PLC/SCADA/DCS) is a strong plus





Benefits


Direct impact on product and culture
Comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability, Transportation benefit, Health and Wellness benefit, and more
401k plan with employer matching
Equity
Competitive salary and bonus opportunities
Dynamic and inclusive work environment
Opportunities for growth and professional development
Access to Greentown Labs' extensive network of cleantech startups





Learn How We Think


Learn about our startup journey: Our Journey
How we're combating climate change: AI-Powered Climate Tech
A customer story: Ben & Jerry's uses H2Ok's precision automation to cut time & water usage





Why H2Ok Innovations?
Impact: Work on cutting-edge AI and sensor tech that’s already transforming how factories use water, energy, and chemicals. Join a tight-knit, ambitious team where your contributions can reshape the industry.

Growth: Join a fast-growing startup where you’ll have the opportunity to shape our content strategy. We value fostering extraordinary growth in our teammates.

Innovative Culture: Work in a high-performance environment that values empowerment, creativity, ownership, autonomy, innovation, excellence, passion, and continuous growth.

Sustainability Focus: Play a key role in promoting sustainability and Industry 4.0 advancements in manufacturing.

Build the intelligence layer powering the next generation of industrial efficiency – with a team that moves fast and delivers real impact.

At H2Ok Innovations, we’re committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. If you're ready to play a key role in scaling a game-changing company that’s transforming the industrial sector and advancing sustainability, we want to hear from you!
